['Topics: Introduction to Critical Thinking, Elements of Thought, Logic and Reasoning, Strategic ProblemSolving.', 'Description: This module covers the fundamentals of critical thinking, including the identification of assumptions, biases, and the evaluation of evidence.', 'Participants will engage in exercises designed to strengthen logical reasoning and strategic problemsolving skills.']

['Topics: Foundations of Negotiation, Preparing for Negotiation, Negotiation Tactics and Strategies, Creating WinWin Outcomes.', 'Description: This module introduces the principles of negotiation, including preparation, strategy formulation, and tactics for achieving mutually beneficial outcomes.', 'Participants will engage in negotiation simulations to apply these concepts in practice.']

['Topics: Clarity and Effective Communication, Courage to Speak Up, Courage to Manage Criticism.', 'Description: Players will engage in intellectually stimulating debates, tackling a variety of topics, and strive to emerge as adept leaders who can guide discussions with finesse and strategic prowess.']

['Topics: Reflective Practice, Goal Setting, developing a Personal Action Plan, Commitment to Change.', 'Description: The final module is dedicated to personal action planning. Participants will reflect on their learning, set personal development goals, and create actionable plans for applying their new skills in their managerial roles. This session will culminate in a commitment to change, fostering accountability and ongoing development.']

['Topics: Identifying Sources of Conflict, Emotional Intelligence in Conflict Resolution, Strategies for Managing Conflict, Mediation and Intervention Techniques.', 'Description: Building on negotiation skills, this module focuses on resolving conflicts, emphasizing the role of emotional intelligence and providing strategies for effective conflict management. Mediation and intervention techniques will be discussed and practiced.']

['Topics: Determine Goals and Objectives, Applying Negotiation Method, Manage Conflict and Crisis.', 'Description: A simulation designed on negotiation skills, focuses on planning strategic negotiation, courage to take responsibility on executed action and manage emotion and conflicts. Understanding of day two lesson can be measured throughout this engaging activity.']
['Topics: Discuss, Revise and Learned.', 'Description: All form of learning must be completed with a session of deep reflection by objective to bring back value to the workplace and life.']

['Project Life Cycle for instance construction starts from Origin i.e', 'Inception/Concept to Design (Architectural & Engineering) followed by Procurement and Construction & finalized by Commissioning/Testing for Completion or Hand Over to Client. In some cases, for construction, it may include Earthworks at the beginning for unsuitable type of soil at location.', 'Project consist of various types based on different Contract coverage. Common types are Design Conventional Project, Turnkey Project, EPCC as mentioned above (EngineeringProcurementConstruction & Commissioning) etc. along with their project life cycle accordingly. For the last few decades, also found new types has embarked predominantly known as Design and Build Fast Track Project, which Contractor plays the role from start to finish with consultant act as advisor and care taker for the Client.']

['Oversees all the project undertaking requirements without flaw from start to end. It is responsibilities of the PM Project Manager ensuring project executed in accordance to the PME 1 9 with HSE + 5S as the principle & policies. Seven (7) Habits of Successful People will be used as guidance in practicing the integrity project management.']

['Identify the content and limits of the project for any sectors mentioned above. WBS Work Breakdown Structures is recommended to define Scope by itemizing the deliverable/product hierarchically. Understanding Scope is fundamental throughout project from Start to End for issues either Technical or Commercial on Contracts, Variations, Claims, Supplementary Agreement, Liquidated Damages LD, Reimbursable or ExGratia for winwin result amicably. WBS can be used for project ‘GO’ or’ ‘NO GO’ initially especially during the tender/bidding stage by reviewing the Technical Application and Commercial Requirement for Feasibility and Viability Analysis respectively. If company has no experience in the technology required e.g. IoT/AI so it is a NO GO. Similarly, if company cannot afford the financial implied, also it is NO GO. WBS is the key to elaborate all the main parameters of projects as per the Triple Constraint:', '1. Time by Planning/Scheduling which can also incorporate CPM Critical Path Method manually or via software', '2. Costing via BOM (Bill of Materials) & BOQ (Bill of Quantity)', '3. Quality referring to Standards/Specifications as imposed.']

['As per Scope above, Time also driven by the project activities dominantly by Predecessor and Successor. Team member has to understand the activities sequence in their profession in meeting the goal timely.', 'The 4 key formats are;', '1. Start to Finish', '2. Start to Start', '3. Finish to Finish', '4. Finish to Start', 'Progress as per Actual vs Plan as reference to the Based Project Plan is crucial to avoid EOT (Extension of Time) which will impact negatively to the company.']

['Cost is driven by 5Ms i.e.', '1. Materials', '2. Machines & tools', '3. Manpower competency', '4. Methodology', '5. Monetary exchange (if foreign exchange applies) ROI (Return On Investment) vs BreakEven Analysis will also be presented for optimum profits.']

['Quality Standards as per QMS Quality Management System requirements will be presented incorporating ISO standards based on the deliverables/products.', 'Apart from HSE + 5S, Quality adherence nowadays must also comply to ESG Environmental, Social & Governance.', 'Selected Quality ethics will be discussed namely JIT Just in Time, Jidoka, Gemba, Lean & Lean Six Sigma and Kaizen.', 'Advance Related Topics for Discussion:', '1. Lean for reduce time', '2. JIT Just in Time to minimize Wastage (Stock / Warehouse / Inventory).', 'Both above will lead to Lean Six Sigma I.e. Zero Defects Target.']

['Manpower and with the right & adequate competencies are critical for project success. As above these will cover the KSA mentioned. The project team organization matrix is paramount important along with the expertise and machines & tooling required. People management of various behaviors and characters will also be discussed.']

['Communications leading to clear & concise information and instruction is crucial & critical for official and unofficial communication channels. With extensive ways of communications nowadays, project team need to discuss and evaluate for the benefit of project and stakeholders. The official channel has to be established upfront to avoid any haywire and overlapping thus separating the fake from the authentic.', 'The worst thing that can happen due to false data/information is REWORK which MUST be avoided as it surely affects all the PM Essentials, especially with the current technology like AI & IOT or AIOT. Individual Exercise for ROI and BreakEven Analysis.']

['Project is fond and vulnerable to Risk. Correct and adequate Coverage is necessary to safeguard the project and company.', 'As example, Construction company will tend to carry out Construction Risk Assessment to identify the potential Risk from any kind of possible hazardous Materials, Acts or others related. Notwithstanding, proper coverage is needed sufficiently.', 'Various types Risk can emerge from many aspects including from the Triple Constraint mentioned earlier i.e.;', '1. Time has limits and cannot delay with EOT Extension of Time forever', '2. Cost to generate profit otherwise better still abandoned the project', '3. Quality has to be complied for certification via ITP Inspection Test Plan & Commissioning /Testing toward CCC or other relevant approval.', '4. Otherwise, the Risk is to REWORK!!!']

module_title: Topic 1: The Board's Mandate: ESG as a Value Driver
submodule_title: ['Why sustainability reporting is essential for competitive advantage and longterm value creation.', 'Navigating evolving investor, regulatory, and customer expectations.', 'Defining "integrated value": Beyond financial metrics to holistic impact and resilience.', "Mini Case Study: A leading global asset manager, facing pressure from institutional investors, divested from a major energy company due to its lagging climate transition plan and poor governance scores. This move, publicly cited by the fund, triggered a significant stock price dip for the energy firm, underscoring the direct financial consequence of perceived ESG underperformance and the board's accountability"]

module_title: Topic 2: Deconstructing Fragmentation: Overcoming Reporting Challenges
submodule_title: ['Identifying common pain points: Siloed data, fragmented efforts, and a lack of cohesive narrative.', 'The tangible costs of missed synergies and incomplete organizational understanding.', "Interactive discussion: Pinpointing your organization's specific challenges and strategic aspirations.", 'Mini Case Study: A global retail giant struggled for years with inconsistent carbon emissions data. Each regional operations team used different methodologies and reporting tools, making it impossible for the central Sustainability team to aggregate accurate, comparable figures. This fragmentation led to missed reduction targets and a lack of credibility in their public disclosures, ultimately hindering their ability to secure green financing.']

module_title: Topic 3: Global Benchmarks & Strategic Frameworks for Impact
submodule_title: ['Overview of leading sustainability reporting frameworks (e.g., GRI, SASB, TCFD, ISSB, ESRS) –', 'focusing on strategic alignment and value creation, not just compliance.', 'Mastering "materiality": Identifying the ESG issues that truly matter to your business and its stakeholders.', 'Case studies: Analyzing bestinclass sustainability reports and their measurable impact.', "Mini Case Study: A global software company initially used GRI for broad impact reporting, but found it didn't fully resonate with techfocused investors. By integrating SASB standards, they sharpened their focus on industryspecific material issues like data privacy, employee diversity in tech roles, and energy consumption of data centers, leading to more targeted and impactful investor engagement."]

module_title: Topic 4: Building a Robust Data Architecture for Sustainability Reporting
submodule_title: ['Identifying critical ESG data points across diverse functions (e.g., operational emissions, supply chain labor practices, diversity metrics, climaterelated financial risks).', 'Strategies for robust data collection, validation, and aggregation, emphasizing accuracy and traceability.', 'Addressing data quality, consistency, and governance challenges.', 'Workshop: Mapping key data sources and flows within your organization, identifying critical integration points.', 'Mini Case Study: An automotive manufacturer successfully implemented a new data architecture by integrating realtime energy consumption data from its production lines (Business Operations) with supply chain emissions data from its tier1 suppliers (Procurement). This unified system, managed by Finance for cost allocation and Sustainability for reporting, provided a granular view of their Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions, enabling precise carbon reduction strategies.']

module_title: Topic 5: Crafting a Strategic Narrative: Beyond the Numbers
submodule_title: ['Principles of effective storytelling in corporate reporting: Connecting purpose, strategy, and measurable performance. Translating complex data into clear, actionable insights for diverse audiences (investors, customers, employees, regulators).', "Techniques for articulating your organization's unique impact and value creation journey.", 'Interactive exercise: Developing a compelling narrative arc for a critical sustainability theme.', 'Mini Case Study: A major food and beverage company transformed its water stewardship narrative. Instead of just reporting cubic meters of water saved, their sustainability report highlighted how their water efficiency programs in waterstressed regions directly supported local community resilience, improved agricultural yields for their suppliers, and secured longterm access to critical resources, resonating strongly with both ethical consumers and impact investors.']
["Key strategic insights and preparation for Day 2's focus on operationalizing collaboration."]

module_title: Topic 6: Principles of High-Performing Cross-Functional Teams
submodule_title: ['Breaking down organizational silos: Fostering shared objectives, mutual understanding, and collective ownership.', 'Establishing effective communication channels and protocols for seamless sustainability reporting.', 'Cultivating a common language and unified vision for ESG performance.', 'Mini Case Study: A global pharmaceutical company faced a complex ethical sourcing challenge for a new drug component. A dedicated crossfunctional task force, comprising R&D, Legal, Procurement, and Sustainability, established clear communication protocols and shared objectives from the outset. This enabled them to navigate intricate regulatory landscapes and secure sustainable, ethical supply chains, preventing significant reputational and operational risks.']

module_title: Topic 7: Introduction to the RACI Matrix for Sustainability Reporting
submodule_title: ['Understanding R (Responsible), A (Accountable), C (Consulted), I (Informed) in the context of complex, multistakeholder reporting processes.', 'Why RACI is critical for clarity, efficiency, and robust accountability in sustainability reporting.']

module_title: Topic 8: Applying RACI: Defining Clear Roles & Responsibilities
submodule_title: ['Interactive Session: Participants will work in crossfunctional groups to apply the RACI framework to core sustainability reporting processes.', 'Discussion of common pitfalls, mitigation strategies, and best practices in RACI implementation for sustained collaboration.', 'Mini Case Study: A large financial services firm struggled to collect comprehensive Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) data for its annual report. Without a clearly defined RACI, the HR team felt solely responsible for data collection, while Finance and Legal only provided input reactively. This led to significant delays and blameshifting. Implementing a clear RACI, with HR as "Responsible," the Head of People as "Accountable," and Finance/Legal as "Consulted" for data definitions, streamlined the process significantly in the following year.']

module_title: Topic 9: Streamlining the Sustainability Reporting Lifecycle
submodule_title: ['Process optimization: Identifying bottlenecks and opportunities for efficiency across data flows and content creation.', 'Leveraging technology and digital tools for enhanced data management, aggregation, and reporting automation.', 'Strategies for seamlessly integrating sustainability data into existing financial, operational, and HR systems.', "Mini Case Study: A major energy utility implemented a new digital platform to automate the collection of energy consumption data from its smart grid infrastructure (Business Operations). This platform seamlessly integrated with the Finance department's billing systems and provided realtime sustainability dashboards for management, drastically reducing manual data entry errors and accelerating quarterly ESG reporting cycles."]

['The critical role of external assurance in bolstering report credibility and stakeholder trust.', 'Preparing for assurance: Establishing robust internal controls, comprehensive documentation, and data readiness.', 'Navigating and adapting to evolving regulatory landscapes and mandatory disclosure requirements.', 'Mini Case Study: A leading consumer goods company faced public scrutiny from environmental NGOs regarding its deforestationfree palm oil commitments. Despite internal reports, skepticism persisted. Only after undergoing a rigorous, independent thirdparty assurance process, which meticulously verified their supply chain data and practices, did the company regain full stakeholder trust and silence its critics, demonstrating the power of external validation.']

module_title: Topic 11: Future-Proofing Your Reporting & Strategic Action Planning
submodule_title: ['Emerging trends in ESG data, artificial intelligence, and digital reporting innovations.', 'Developing a phased roadmap for continuous improvement in sustainability reporting capabilities.', 'Group Exercise: Crafting a concrete, collaborative action plan for immediate implementation within your organization.', 'Mini Case Study: A global technology firm is piloting an AIpowered analytics tool that scans vast datasets of social media, news, and customer feedback to identify emerging ESG risks (e.g., labor unrest in a new market, supply chain disruptions due to climate events). This proactive intelligence informs their sustainability strategy, risk management, and future reporting disclosures, allowing them to adapt faster than competitors.']
['Consolidating key takeaways and fostering a commitment to collaborative action.', 'Providing resources for ongoing learning, peer networking, and sustained support.']

submodule_title: ['Sustainability & ESG 101', 'Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)', 'The World Economic Forum 2025 Global Risks, e.g. extreme weather, biodiversity loss', 'Competitive Imperative: Business Cases to Act and Why', 'Case Study', 'Objective:', 'To establish a collaborative environment, setting the stage for active learning and participation throughout the day. Highlight the urgency of global ESG issues and explain how businesses can adapt to align with the SDGs and regulatory requirements.']

submodule_title: ['Employee Wellbeing and Workplace Safety', 'Community Engagement', 'Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI)', 'Human Rights and Supply Chain Practices', 'Employee Wellbeing and Workplace Safety', 'Case study', 'Objective: Equip participants with tools to create impactful social sustainability programs that resonate with DEI and human rights compliance trends.']

submodule_title: ['Principles of Good Governance', 'AntiCorruption Strategies', 'Transparency and Ethical Reporting', 'Board Oversight on ESG', 'Case study', "Objective: Empower participants to understand governance's critical role in ESG strategy and its alignment with anticorruption and regulatory expectations."]

module_title: Module 6: ESG Regulation, Reporting and Standards
submodule_title: ['Overview of ESG Reporting Standards', 'Reporting Essentials and Mechanics', 'Assurance in ESG Reporting', 'Simulated Case Study', 'Group Activity', 'Objective: Provide an overview of global reporting frameworks (e.g., ISSB, GRI, NSRF, SEDG) and key ESG regulations, (e.g., EU CSRD, EU CSDDD) to ensure regulatory compliance and create value. submodule_title: ['AIDriven ESG Reporting', 'Data Analytics for ESG', 'Blockchain for Transparency in ESG', 'IoT and ESG Monitoring', 'Digital Twin Technology for ESG Strategy Testing', 'Emerging Technologies in ESG (e.g. Generative AI and Carbon Capture & Storage)', 'Case study', 'Objective: Provide an overview of leveraging technology to successful sustainability implementation. Equip participants with knowledge and handson experience to leverage technology effectively for ESG data management, reporting, and decisionmaking, positioning their organizations for future sustainability challenges.']

submodule_title: ['Interactive and Immersive Simulation Exercise', 'Peer Feedback on Action Plans', 'Share Key Learnings', 'Personal Reflection', 'Case Study', 'Objective: Integrating all modules learned so far. module_title: Session 1: The Sustainability Imperative & Regulatory Landscape
submodule_title: ['Welcome & Program Overview: Setting the stage for two days of intensive learning.', 'Global to Local: The Urgency of ESG in Malaysia:', 'o Global and industryspecific trends in sustainability, including regulatory changes and stakeholder expectations. Differentiate various sustainability reporting frameworks such as GRI, SASB, CDP, TCFD, TNFD, ISSB IFRS, EU CSRD, and US SEC', 'o Drivers for enhanced ESG reporting: Investor expectations (local and international), key regulatory landscape, supply chain pressures, talent attraction, and financial implications.', "o Malaysia's commitment to sustainability: National policies, UN SDGs, and the shift towards a lowcarbon economy.", "Bursa Malaysia's Enhanced Sustainability Reporting Framework:", 'o Indepth analysis of Main Market and ACE Market Listing Requirements: Current mandatory disclosures, phased implementation for Group 1 and Group 2 PLCs.', 'o Key changes and expectations: Common Sustainability Matters, threeyear performance data, and the journey towards assurance.', 'o Practical Example: Dissecting a recent Bursa Malaysia Circular on Sustainability Reporting amendments.', "Securities Commission Malaysia's Role in SRI and Governance:", 'o The Sustainable and Responsible Investment (SRI) Roadmap: How it impacts corporate practices and investor engagement.', 'o Malaysian Code on Corporate Governance (MCCG) and ESG Integration: Board oversight, accountability, and the link between governance and sustainability performance.', "Case Study 1: Navigating Early Adoption – A Malaysian PLC's Journey with Bursa Requirements. (Interactive discussion on challenges and successes based on an anonymous Malaysian company's recent sustainability statement)."]

module_title: Session 2: Laying the Foundation – ISSB Standards
submodule_title: ['Introduction to the IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards (ISSB):', 'o Purpose, objectives, and global acceptance of IFRS S1 and IFRS S2.', 'o The "climatefirst" approach and the role of the National Sustainability Reporting Framework (NSRF) in Malaysia\'s adoption with limited transition.', 'o Understanding the building blocks: Governance, Strategy, Risk Management, and Metrics & Targets.', 'IFRS S1 – General Requirements for Disclosure of Sustainabilityrelated Financial Information:', 'o Conceptual Deep Dive: Core content requirements, reporting entity, material sustainabilityrelated financial information.', 'o Practical Application: Identifying material sustainability matters using the ISSB lens and local context.', 'o Case Study 2: Materiality Assessment for a Malaysian PLC. Participants will work in groups to identify and prioritize material ESG issues for a hypothetical Malaysian company (e.g., a manufacturing company or a property developer) considering local environmental and social sensitivities.', 'IFRS S2 – Climaterelated Disclosures: The Core Climate Standard:', 'o Detailed review of climaterelated disclosure requirements across the four pillars.', 'o Understanding physical and transition risks and opportunities relevant to Malaysian industries (e.g., impact of climate change on agriculture, palm oil, tourism, manufacturing supply chains).']

['Interoperability: ISSB, GRI, and TCFD in the Malaysian Context:', 'o Key differences and overlaps: How to leverage existing GRI and TCFD reporting efforts to meet ISSB requirements.', 'o Conducting a practical Gap Analysis: Identifying current disclosure gaps and developing an action plan for ISSB compliance.', "o Case Study 3a: Bridging the Divide – A Malaysian Conglomerate's Approach to Integrating Multiple Frameworks. Analysis of a listed company's sustainability report, identifying how they align or distinguish between different reporting standards.", 'Governance Pillar: Board Oversight and Internal Controls for ESG:', 'o Establishing effective governance structures: Board committees, management roles, and accountability for ESG.', 'o Integrating ESG into existing enterprise risk management (ERM) frameworks.', 'o Case Study 3b: PLC’s governance platforms to manage sustainability – examples at listed multinationals and corporations. Developing an ESG governance structure. Participants will map out an ideal ESG governance structure for their organization, considering local corporate governance best practices.']

['Strategy Pillar: Linking Sustainability to Business Resilience:', 'o Identifying and assessing sustainabilityrelated risks and opportunities: Focus on Malaysianspecific scenarios (e.g., water scarcity, labor practices in specific sectors, renewable energy opportunities).', 'o Integrating ESG into strategic planning and capital allocation decisions.', 'o Case Study 4: Current and Anticipated Financial Effects of Sustainability Risks and Opportunities.', 'Quantifying Financial Impacts. Using provided data scenarios (e.g., carbon tax impact, supply chain disruptions, green financing benefits), participants will estimate potential financial effects for PLCs in group discussions.']

module_title: Session 5: Climate Disclosure and Scenario Analysis
submodule_title: ['Metrics & Targets Pillar: Focus on ClimateRelated Metrics:', 'o Comprehensive GHG Emissions Accounting (Scope 1, 2, & 3): Methodologies, data collection challenges in Malaysia (e.g., supply chain data for Scope 3).', "o Setting meaningful and ambitious climate targets: SBTi (Science Based Targets initiative) and alignment with Malaysia's Net Zero ambitions.", 'Deep Dive 2: Climate Scenario Analysis for Malaysian PLCs.', 'o Understanding different climate scenarios (e.g., IEA NZE, RCPs): Relevance to Malaysian industries.', 'o Practical Steps for Conducting Scenario Analysis: Data requirements, analytical tools, and interpreting results.', 'o Handson Exercise 3: Simplified Climate Scenario Analysis Application. Participants will work through a simplified climate scenario for a Malaysian industry (e.g., real estate, financial services, or manufacturing), identifying potential impacts and strategic responses.', "Case Study 5: A Malaysian Bank's Approach to Climate Risk Integration and Scenario Analysis. Discussion on how financial institutions are responding to BNM's climate risk management expectations. Or, Financial Institutions in managing climatetocredit risks."]

module_title: Session 6: Risk Management and Data Integrity
submodule_title: ['Risk Management Pillar: Identifying, Assessing, and Managing Sustainability Risks:', 'o Integrating sustainability risks into enterprisewide risk management (ERM) frameworks.', 'o Emerging ESG risks relevant to Malaysia: Biodiversity loss, human rights in supply chains, cyber security and data privacy.', 'o Workshop: ESG Risk Matrix Development. Participants will develop a preliminary ESG risk matrix for their organization, categorizing and prioritizing risks.', 'Data Management for Robust ESG Reporting:', 'o Establishing robust internal controls for ESG data: Collection, aggregation, quality checks, and audit trails.', 'o Leveraging tech solutions: ESG software, data analytics, and reporting platforms.', 'o Addressing data challenges common in Malaysia: Data availability, consistency, and fragmentation across departments.', 'Case Study 6: Data Journey of a Malaysian Utility Company for ESG Reporting. Insights into data collection processes, challenges, and solutions adopted.']

module_title: Session 7: Crafting the Report & Assurance Readiness
submodule_title: ['Crafting a Compliant and Impactful Sustainability Statement:', 'o Structure and content of an ISSBaligned sustainability report.', 'o Best practices in clear, concise, and balanced disclosure.', 'o Narrative reporting vs. quantitative data: Achieving the right balance.', 'o Illustrative Sustainability Report: Utilizing the forthcoming Malaysian illustrative report (based on GRI and ISSB) as a practical guide.', 'The Evolving Landscape of Assurance for Sustainability Statements in Malaysia:', "o Bursa Malaysia's stance on assurance: Current recommendations and future outlook.", 'o Understanding different levels of assurance (limited vs. reasonable).', 'o Preparing for assurance readiness: Documentation, internal controls, and engaging with assurers.', 'o An overview of ISSA 5000 (International Standard on Sustainability Assurance 5000) developed by the International Auditing and Assurance Standards Board (IAASB), and the connection with the ISSB IFRS S1/S2 reporting.', 'o Case Study 7: Common challenges faced by Malaysian PLCs in seeking assurance and how to overcome them.']

['Developing a Phased Implementation Roadmap for ISSB Adoption:', 'o Prioritizing actions and resource allocation.', 'o Stakeholder engagement strategy for ESG reporting.', 'o Internal communication and capacity building within the organization (PACE initiative).', 'Beyond Compliance: Value Creation through ESG:', 'o Linking strong ESG performance to access to sustainable finance (SRI Sukuk, green loans).', 'o Enhancing reputation, attracting talent, and fostering innovation.', 'Future Trends and Emerging Areas in ESG Reporting for Malaysia:', 'o Naturerelated financial disclosures (TNFD).', 'o The role of AI and digitalization in ESG.', "Case Study 8: Artificial Intelligence and Water Stress: A global tech company's AI data center in a droughtprone region drew public backlash after excessive water use for cooling exacerbated local water scarcity, harming communities and ecosystems amid limited transparency and accountability.", 'Concluding Remarks & Open Forum: Final Q&A, sharing of best practices, and next steps for continuous improvement in ESG reporting.']

submodule_title: ['Topic A: Customizing the PowerPoint Interface', 'Find and add menu items and buttons that you frequently use to your ribbon or quick access toolbar to give you faster access to the PowerPoint features you probably use the most.', 'Topic B: Changing Themes and Colors', 'Quickly change the colors, fonts, effects or design of your entire presentation in almost a single mouse click.']

['Topic A: The Content Placeholder and Bullet Levels', 'Use placeholders to quickly add content to your slides including text, diagrams, and charts – so that you can later change the location and proportions of these objects, often with a single mouse click.', 'Topic B: Formatting Text', 'Format text in your presentation so that it is legible and perhaps even pleasant to look at!', 'Topic C: Adding and Manipulating Shapes', 'Add and work with shapes, which are one of the most important building blocks on a slide, including rectangles, ovals, and triangles.', 'Topic D: Duplicate and Add Multiple Shapes', 'Reuse existing, formatted shapes to save time inserting shape content on your slides.', 'Topic E: Group and Ungroup Shapes', 'Group various shapes together into a single slide object to help you position the group of shapes in a specific location, while still gaining access to the size and formatting options available within PowerPoint for those individual shapes']

submodule_title: ['o Welcome participants and set the tone for the training program.', 'o Facilitate introductions among participants to foster networking and collaboration.', 'o Conduct an icebreaking activity to encourage interaction and create a comfortable learning environment.', 'o Briefly outline the agenda and objectives of the twoday training.']

module_title: Introduction to Strategic Communications and Stakeholder Engagement
submodule_title: ['o Define strategic communications and its importance in achieving business objectives.', 'o Explain the concept of stakeholder engagement and its role in building relationships.', 'o Discuss the benefits of effective strategic communications and stakeholder engagement for organizational success.', 'o Highlight the key principles and best practices in strategic communications.', 'o Discuss how stakeholder engagement contributes to sustainability and growth.']
